body:
Working off commit 03d39ed34cfab7008232678c8dd2ba5103a569e6

I had to update a variant to a new git commit ID to work around a bug, but spack fetched the variant from the local cache with a tarball built from the previous commit ID. This lead to a confusing silent error where the same commit ID (and same bug) got rebuilt. If not already done, the cache name should be based on a commit ID to avoid accidentally building an old commit.
title: Changing the commit ID for a variant does not invalidate tarball cache
